title: Early Action Reports after fatal collisions and locations of KSI's

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council
Please could you provide the Early Action reports made after fatal collisions on Sheffield roads in the last 5 years.
Could you also provide the list of 59 locations identified as having at least 3 KSIs (Killed or seriously injured) in the Road Safety Action Plan? Please provide the conclusions of investigations into the 17 or more of these that have been investigated so far.
Yours faithfully
Graham Wroe

Dear Graham Wroe,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Early Action
Reports after fatal collisions and locations of KSI's which we received on
08/10/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request below:
Please could you provide the Early Action reports made after fatal
collisions on Sheffield roads in the last 5 years.
The Early Action reports contain confidential information, including
details of the fatal collision received from South Yorkshire Police, which
might have relevance for future Coroner’s Inquests or Police
Prosecutions.  Releasing such information into the public domain could
prejudice these proceedings or lead to individuals being identified.
The information is exempt from disclosure under Regulation 12(3) of the
Environmental Information Regulations 2004 (EIR) and Regulation 13 EIR as
amended by Sch. 19, para 307 of the Data Protection Act 2018, which
provide an exception for where the information requested includes personal
data where disclosure would contravene the data protection principles of
the UK General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Disclosure of the
information would contravene the data protection principle under Article
5(1)(a) that processing of personal data must be lawful, fair, and
transparent.
The rest of the information has been withheld under Regulation 12(5)(b) of
the EIR, which provides an exception from the disclosure of environmental
information which would adversely affect the course of justice. The course
of justice covers the the ability of a person to receive a fair trial or
the ability of a public authority to conduct an inquiry of a criminal or
disciplinary nature. This exception is subject to a public interest test.
Factors in favour of disclosing the information are that disclosure
promotes openness and transparency. Factors in favour of maintaining the
exception are that it is important not to undermine the court process and
the jurisdiction of the court, which has the power to determine what may
be disclosed, and this serves the wider administration of justice. On
balance, the Council believes that the public interest lies in maintaining
the exception.
Could you also provide the list of 59 locations identified as having at
least 3 KSIs (Killed or seriously injured) in the Road Safety Action Plan?
Please provide the conclusions of investigations into the 17 or more of
these that have been investigated so far.
Please find attached the latest list of the locations that have been
identified for inclusion in the Local Safety Scheme programme. The
conclusions of the investigations carried out so far are included. This is
an ongoing project and is not yet completed, therefore not all locations
have conclusions recorded. Please note that based on the latest collision
data there are 53 locations on this list in total, not 59.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Thank you for your request for information relating to Early Action

Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
We are withholding this information under Regulation 12(5)(b) as
disclosure would have an adverse effect on the course of justice. This is
because these reports are covered by police investigations and potentially
coroner’s inquests.
This exception is subject to a public interest test. Factors in favour of
disclosing the information are that disclosure promotes openness and
transparency. Factors in favour of maintaining the exception are that it
is important to protect the course of justice, including law enforcement
investigations and proceedings. We believe that placing this information
into the public domain outside the legal process would be unfair and
detrimental to the parties concerned. On balance, the Council believes
that the public interest lies in maintaining the exception.
We could provide a list of fatal locations and the collision types.
